cyclone.name: MARIA
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest across the Leeward Islands then over the northeastern Caribbean Sea toward Puerto Rico and the Dominican Republic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Puerto Rico (close to or just south of San Juan)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None for Puerto Rico yet; Hurricane Watch already in effect for U.S. & British Virgin Islands
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Guadeloupe southward to Martinique, Dominica, St. Kitts–Nevis–Montserrat
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Leeward Islands chain west-northwest through the U.S./British Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (60–87%) of tropical-storm-force winds with a 22% chance of hurricane-force winds; sustained winds around 50–75 kt possible near landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 5–7 ft surge along south and east coasts of Puerto Rico including San Juan Bay entrance, accompanied by large, destructive waves.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 in, locally up to 20 in, producing life-threatening flash flooding and mudslides.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas and dangerous rip currents; debris flow into harbor channels; possible loss of power/communications affecting port operations.
